channel.title: Truly a great man
channel.description:
[youtube]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MQtWDYHd3FY[/youtube] Look at that 1984 imac that still looked better than windows 95 [youtube]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kN0SVBCJqLs[/youtube] changing how we hear music for life? [youtube]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6uW-E496FXg&feature=related[/youtube] changing how we used phones for life? [youtube]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7GRv-kv5XEg[/youtube] The first Nano [youtube]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=F9E2JCtWzk8[/youtube] The Ipad, truly great product [youtube]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1QztwBzcVaw&feature=related[/youtube] something you probably did not know
I think any of his inventions exceeded bill gates at anytime (my opinion)
Oh my god you changed society for life: how we hear music, computer, worlds first "true" smartphone The products I have of Apple: Ipad, Ipad 2, Ipod shuffle gen 1 and latest Discuss your truly great inspirer

item.title: Truly a great man
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Bitch2 Java Is My Bitch
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch2 wrote:

The term “PC” was registered by IBM. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IBM_Personal_Computer

Read full topic

item.title: Truly a great man
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

Dennis Ritchie, RIP. Thanks Drub for posting that, you have opened my eyes.

Read full topic

item.title: Truly a great man
item.dc:creator: @whattehp406 whattehp406
item.description:
@whattehp406 wrote:

[quote=“gravenfire23, post:165, topic:427807”][quote author=whattehp406 link=topic=530500.msg3882184#msg3882184 date=1326128959]

[quote author=gravenfire23 link=topic=530500.msg3882182#msg3882182 date=1326128922]

[quote author=whattehp406 link=topic=530500.msg3882180#msg3882180 date=1326128747]

[quote author=zyle1992 link=topic=530500.msg3882179#msg3882179 date=1326128654]

[quote author=whattehp406 link=topic=530500.msg3882172#msg3882172 date=1326127823]

The news praise him as god of computing,

More of a marketer… Mac still sucks not even a PC. =.=

what? well fuck Mac isn’t a pc? well woah there That’s big news
Well it is not supposed to be a Pc
he is an inventor not a marketer,
sony, samsung are marketers, Okay? bye
[/quote]Hey

Sonly made playstation, nuff said
Jobs was an outstanding marketer with brilliant idea’s but not a fucking inventor.
And he means, mac isn’t a personal computer, not customizable as much as the windows computers we have.

Mac = Operating System
Windows = Operating System
Linux = Operating System
PC = Personal Computer

Any operating system can go on a PC.
[/quote]No, mac is fabricated to only work with apple computers
[/quote]With a few minor tweaks mac can go on a pc
[/quote]would be shit tho since mac software isn’t made for that
[/quote]im not much of a fan of macs as it is, i don’t like paying thousands of dollars for a computer with alot of limitations[/quote]Yeah, same here.

Read full topic

item.title: Truly a great man
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

[quote=“chillwitm888, post:138, topic:427807”]He doesn’t even know his real dad, growing up with fostering parents then later finds out that it’s not their own parents, a very complex feeling for a child
Does Having a sad life, always have to involve in someone dying?[/quote]

He was adopted as a baby and always knew they were his adoptive parents. He chose to ignore his own dad.

For a man you seem to worship so much, maybe you should read his biography?

Read full topic

item.title: Truly a great man
item.dc:creator: @chillwitm888 chillwitm888
item.description:
@chillwitm888 wrote:

[quote=“chillwitm888, post:156, topic:427807”][quote author=RandQm link=topic=530500.msg3881697#msg3881697 date=1326072811]

Justin Bieber. ^
is just getting alot of media attention =.=

read about his childhood,

I did, his adoptive parents were pretty good to him, despite Steve being a bit of a dick to them on certain occasions.

I guess so, He lectures Obama:
http://www.washingtonpost.com/business/economy/steve-jobs-opens-up-about-adoption-loves-faith-in-new-biography/2011/10/21/gIQAMZpu4L_story.html

Let’s talk about the lives of the people living on the street around you and then go back to steve fags

how about let’s stay on topic, OR you Make a topic on your own about that

It is OT
since u say he had a hard life, we have to find what is actually the meaning of a hard life, is it not getting the newest gayPad of your parents or is it dying on the street

He doesn’t even know his real dad, growing up with fostering parents then later finds out that it’s not their own parents, a very complex feeling for a child
Does Having a sad life, always have to involve in someone dying?

Like some one said before,
all cool that he’s adopted,
but many kids are adopted and they don’t get recognized for their “hard life”

Get adopted, live through a poor life then become a world public figure, that’s difficult.

Let me fix that for you

public figure for mainstream brainwashed hipsters

top of the greatest media production companies use macs
The news praise him as god of computing,
Look up hipsters
http://www.urbandictionary.com/define.php?term=hipsters
they are not mainstream

pause there

The news praise him as god of computing,

now think and smack yourself

l2readthenews

since the media always tells the truth
lmao no love for you anymore

Underaged kids tell more truth than the media, well okay bye

If yr talking about me I’m adult

& yeah media is true http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fk-qRU2nAUQ

in my statement i said right there, did i say everything said by the media is true

So what you are saying is, if it fits you it’s true

So what you are saying is, if it fits you it’s true, at you too

no just no ^
There a difference between objective and logic looking to whats told than believing what fits you - in your case

What you are saying is a bunch of opinion just like i am okay?
It does not make you cool to argue that you think you are better than the media with tons of experience than you do
You don’t. So okay this is all rather opinion bye

ZDNet

Without Dennis Ritchie, there would be no Steve Jobs | ZDNet

Modern computing as we know it would not have existed without Dennis Ritchie, father of the C programming language and co-creator of the UNIX operating system.


I believe this has been resolved pages back kay thanks bye
and btw no ritchie = no gates as well byeee

Read full topic
